conclusion: The acceleration of a particle is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
For particle A, during the deceleration phase (from 3t_0 to 4t_0), the slope of the graph is negative and constant.
For particle B, during the deceleration phase (from 5t_0 to 6t_0), the slope of the graph is also negative and constant.

premise: The magnitude of the slope (and hence the acceleration) for particle A is greater than that for particle B, as the line for A is steeper than the line for B.
conclusion: The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their deceleration phases is greater than 1.
